column4: does anyone know howto autoload a module at boot using --force-vermagic in breezy?
Might have something to do with /etc/modprobe.d
Never had to use it myself, but check some of the files in there for examples, and write your own file to pass --force-vermagic or whatever to the modprobe command.
k thanks, will look into that
a local.start file would have been handy since you can just put the complete command in there like ' modprobe --force-vermagic fglrx '
The modprobe.d directory is slightly more complex, but you should be able to accomplish the same stuff without mucking about with /etc/init.d and /etc/rc?.d symlinks.
fixed it with a crontab and @reboot
A crontab?? Why would you need that?
not quite what it was meant for, but an easier fix than messing with modprobe files i haven't time to figure out :)
Right... so you just put in the --force-vermagic in the crontab entry.
